Description: 4-digit number identifier of the visited feature

Denotes the source of the first observation, with the options being: digitized from a Soviet map (ie. legacy data verification), encountered during the walk to the mapped location (Survey), seen in satellite images (RS),  advised by local informant, etc.
Datatype_Vocabularies: Legacy verification; RS (Remote sensing ground truthing); Survey; Local informant; Serendipity; Other

Description: Definition of the feature that we encountered in the field in the location of the mapped symbol or en route to it, the options including burial mounds, settlement mounds, surface scatters, etc.
Datatype_Vocabularies: Burial Mound, Extinct Burial Mound, Tell, Surface Scatter, Other

Description: How certain was the team about the Type definition above?
Majority landuse in the immediate neighborhood of the mound
Datatype_Vocabularies: Annual agriculture, Perennial agriculture, Pasture, Scrub, Urban, Other

Description: Landuse on the top of mound
Datatype_Vocabularies: Annual agriculture, Perennial agriculture, Pasture, Scrub, Urban, Other

Description: Date of the field visit in yyyy-mm-dd format
Maximum diameter of mound in meters
Maximum height of mound in meters
Preservation status of mound assessed on the Likert scale. Original values were: 0 - No observation; 1 - pristine; 2 - minor damage; 3 - damaged; 4 - seriously damaged; 5 - extinct or near extinct
What seems to be the principal driver of mound decline? Select one value from the list:
Datatype_Vocabularies: No observation; Anthropogenic [Agriculture; Looting; Excavation; Road cut; Construction; Urban; Development]; Animal activity; Bioturbation; Natural[Erosion, Post-depositional]; Other (specify in annotation)

Description: Number that map symbols received upon digitisation; 6-digit numbers were digitized in desktop GIS, while 16 digit uuids come from FAIMS Map-digitisation mobile app. NAs refer to mounds/features found in the field but not in 1:50,000 maps
Name of the mound or its locale extracted from the map upon digitisation

Aggregated annotations entered by field assistants when describing mounds in the structured form. Annotations were exported in parentheses behind the structured input (see PrincipalSourceOfImpact) and were split away and placed in this column to facilitate structured column analysis. They are mostly comments on details of landuse, condition, dimensions, robber's trenches (RTs) and other interventions
Distance from the center of mound to the nearest settlement center
Distance from the mound center to the nearest settlement boundary
Elevation in meters above sea level for mound extracted from the mosaiced JICA ASTER DEM
Slope at mound location in degrees extracted from the mosaiced JICA ASTER DEM
Aspect at mound location extracted from the mosaiced JICA ASTER DEM. Numeric values are within 0 -360 degrees representing the cardinal directions of aspect

Terrain Ruggedness Index extracted from JICA ASTER DEM at mound location. TRI measures the amount of elevation difference between eight adjacent cells of a DEM according to Wilson et al. (2007). The eight elevation differences are squared and averaged. The square root of this average results is a TRI measurement for the center cell.
Topographic Position Index extracted from JICA ASTER DEM at mound location. TPI measures the difference between the value of a cell and the mean value of its 8 surrounding cells (ie. ~30m radius).
Roughness is extracted from JICA ASTER DEM at mound location. It measures the difference between the maximum and the minimum value of a cell and its 8 surrounding cells.
Prominence250m_percent is calculated following Llobera's formula as the percentage of cells within a radius of 250m whose altitude is lower than the present cell.
Distance to Bulgarian national border in meters
Number that identifies the present feature in the Archaeological Map of Bulgaria
Chronology and other notes on cultural heritage from AKB
This field indicates whether for a given location there is a single or multiple observations
TRAP number for another observation at the same location

A column that identifies all unique observations of burial mounds and can be used to filter out unique values. Where there are duplicates, the later version is selected which observations postdating 2010.

A column that identifies all unique observations of burial mounds and can be used to filter out unique values. Where there are duplicates, the early version is selected which dates to 2010 or earlier.
Coordinate along x axis projected into WGS84 UTM35N (epgs 32635)
Coordinate along y axis projected into WGS84 UTM35N (epgs 32635)
